question: What was the main reason which gave impetus to the Kalinga War of 261 BC?
option1: Sibling rivalry among Ashoka and his brothers
option2: Ashoka wanted to spread Buddhism in Kalinga
explanation: Kaling was situated between Mahanadi and Godavari rivers. After the cessation of the Nanda dynasty, Kalinga made an alliance with Cholas and Pandya of the south and became the competitor of Magadha in the field of Sea trade.
